title: U.S. Senate - composition by political party affiliation 1983 to 2019
summary: You are viewing a chart of multi-line type with 3 lines denoting Democrat, Republican, and Other parties. The y axis indicates the Number of senators and the x axis indicates Year.
Overall Republican is gradually increasing, Democrat is gradually decreasing, Other parties is roughly constant,  throughout the Year
The ranking of the lines from topmost to botommmost is as follows: 1. Republican, 2. Democrat, and lastly, 3. Other parties.

Overall across the Year, Republican mostly maintained the highest Number of senators when compared to others with a mean value of 49.74, and it peaked at 104th_Congress_1995, 105th_Congress_1997, 106th_Congress_1999, and 109th_Congress_2005.
After Republican, Democrat overall has the second highest values , with a mean value of 49.3, peaking at 103d_Congress_1993.

Other parties mostly had the least Number of senators with a mean value of 0.84, which peaked at 110th_Congress_2007, 111th_Congress_2009, 112th_Congress_2011, 113th_Congress_2013, 114th_Congress_2015, 115th_Congress_2017, and 116th_Congress_2019 with a value of 2.0.

max_summary: This is a multi-line chart with 3 lines representing Democrat, Republican, and Other parties. The y axis denotes Number of senators and the x axis denotes Year.
Overall Republican is gradually increasing, Democrat is gradually decreasing, Other parties is roughly constant,  throughout the Year
The lines ordered according to average values of Number of senators in descending order is: 1. Republican, 2. Democrat, and lastly, 3. Other parties.

Throughout the period, Republican generally had the highest Number of senators relative to others with an average of 49.74, and it reached its maximum at 104th_Congress_1995, 105th_Congress_1997, 106th_Congress_1999, and 109th_Congress_2005 with a value of 55.0.
Followed by Democrat which ranks as the second topmpost line , with an average of 49.3 Number of senators,reaching its highest point  at 103d_Congress_1993 with a value of 57.0.

Other parties mostly had the least Number of senators with a mean value of 0.84, which peaked at 110th_Congress_2007, 111th_Congress_2009, 112th_Congress_2011, 113th_Congress_2013, 114th_Congress_2015, 115th_Congress_2017, and 116th_Congress_2019 with a value of 2.0.
